wikipedia_page.main: Dominic Thomas (born 14 February 1996) is a Scottish professional footballer who plays as a winger for Dunfermline Athletic. Thomas, who started his professional career with Motherwell, has also played for Kilmarnock and has been on loan over two spells at both Queen of the South and Dumbarton.

link_mentions.page: PFA Scotland Team of the Year
List of Scottish Professional Football League monthly award winners

response: He attended Trinity High School, Rutherglen and was in the same year group as fellow Celtic youth team player Dom Thomas, who broke through as a professional with Motherwell and was later a teammate at Kilmarnock.

link_mentions.page: 2016–17 Queen of the South F.C. season

response: On 1 January 2017, Motherwell announced that Dom Thomas had moved to Queen of the South on loan until the end of the season.
